greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Irregular triangle read by rows where n-th row contains all quadratic residues (including zero) mod n.
link: T. D. Noe, Rows n = 1..100, flattened
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Quadratic Residue.
maple: q:=n-> sort(convert({seq(i^2 mod n,i=0..n-1)}, list)); # _N. J. A. Sloane_, Feb 09 2011
mathematica: row[n_] := Table[PowerMod[k, 2, n], {k, 0, n-1}] // Union; Table[row[n], {n, 1, 20}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Sep 09 2013 *)
program: (PARI) T(n) = {local(v,r,i,j,k); v=vector(n,i,0); for(i=0,floor(n/2),v[i^2%n+1]=1); k=sum(i=1,n,v[i]); j=0; r=vector(k); for(i=1,n, if(v[i], j++; r[j]=i-1)); r}
xref: Cf. A046071 (without zeros), A000224 (row lengths), A063987.
Last elements of rows give A047210.
results.author: _Cino Hilliard_, Jul 20 2004
